comments.html:
to be fair, the addition of the label-switch controller (LSC) on the stratacom switches was not a function of an anemic CPU on the control processor for the ATM switches.

the ATM switches actually had a considerable amount of novel capability here and the underlying switching hardware could be partitioned for ATM switching using well ... take your pick AutoRoute or PNNI, as well as supporting an LSC. getting all of these to cohabitate on different operating systems (vxworks vs. IOS) was an entirely different matter.

bolting a 7200 onto the ATM switch was actually a pretty slick solution.
comments.name: steve ulrich
